Here is the preceding version that drew comments for improvement:
Spoiler [+]

I am within pretty unfamiliar grounds with this build, but i have tried to do my best.

What you have here is a really well protected Halfling with six attacks per round wielding two nasty little blades and moving in a flurry. Might as well imagine that Hin to be a lone commando, a survivalist that has learned many diverse techniques in order to operate in foreign grounds. To those unfamiliar with the tremendous advantages of being permanently immune to all mind-effects you can see them in detail in any of my kensai builds (Whirlwind of Steel/ Raigeki-the Lightning Strike), now add to that the AC provided from a max-dexterity Halfling with almost half a thousand hp's and you will be grinning in no time, like myself.

Some of you might ask, "why not a single kama in a warrior-monk build" ? The answer to that is very simple, the kukris once they get some enchantments on them via UMD or other source are far superior to a single kama, far outperforming them in almost any situation. And we will have to thing about our good looks too, right? For all his merits though, he isn't without some issues, three that i am aware off in fact,

* Hin-Hurricane has a (20%) XP penalty since he utilizes three base classes (one favorite), it might hurt some of you that want to play him in single-player modules. But then again it was never intended as such.
* After all my builds that are heavy-hitters, this does feel like a woodpecker. You will have other answers like your traps and umd, but the fact remains that you want to get your hands on a pair of good kukris to take full advantage of what this build has to offer.
* You can't be a true Ironman without ED and this Hin does not have it, to take real advantage of that very high AC. The solution here is to go with a (20/10/10) class split but it is not so easy as it sounds, although i am trying out different solutions to this.

On with the build itself,

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
*scratching head*

You wouldn't sacrifice 1 AB and 1 DEX AC for Epic Dodge? 

The  20/10/10 class split you mention in passing would net the mind-control you seek, ED, both Toughness and Expertise, a few more sneaks and at least 20 more skill points to throw around. SR reduced by 5 seems a worthwhile compromise to me along with scrapping 2 Grt DEX since a high-level caster will still penetrate 35 easily anyway.  Otherwise, you are right.  Using all the general epic feats for Grt DEX prevents any option for ED (or any other feats for that matter).

DWing kamas would hit more often with 8 APR (9  hasted, 10 w/FoB) and the monk progression intact; w/DEX 34 I got a +41/+38/+35/+32/+29/+26/+41/+38 progression with DW kamas (no haste, no FoB)   Admittedly, kukris offer more crit opportunities but only against mediocre ACs.  Else, kamas would dominate hands down.  Either weapon can be keened with scrolls. 

There must be some sort of roleplay issue you are trying to factor in (or qualify for some item or other prerequisite with DEX 36), and if that is the case, please detail it so an old man like me doesn't get more confused than he already is.  Have pity dear soul

I was staring at these stats wondering what seemed wrong while I was trying to glean the ranged AB as a req'd stat for import so needed to do a quick calculation to check my suspicions.  This is how it went:

Ranged AB = 26 (BAB) + 13 (DEX) + 1 (Prowess) = +40 AB

So how come the melee WF/EWF listed here only adds +2 AB more?  Answer: It doesn't, but it is close.

Melee AB (finessed) = 26 (BAB) + 13 (DEX) + 1 (Prowess) + 1 (WF) + 2 (EWF) = +43 AB

Which translates into: 1H progression of +43/+38/+33/+28 and 2H progression of +41/+36/+31/+26/+41/+36

Naturally, the 1H progression is essentially insignificant in this build since a monk would lose its monk bonuses holding a shield, though there may be a scant few situations where dropping the OH kukri for an extra 2AB may make more of an impact than an increased APR.

One thing worth noting about the comparison with DW kamas is that the off-hand progression does NOT use the monk -3AB schedule so would match the kukri one itemized here (+41/+36).

In addition, the naked AC 39 number seems fantasy to me. 

I get: 10 + 13 Dex + 5 Monk +1 size + 8 Tumble = 37.  Besides being unable to account for the missing 2AC (someone out there... plz educate!), the skill set does not allocate to Tumble so am figuring it was just an oversight but have no time to go through the entire build to determine the allocation (Once again, the lack of a skill allotment schedule severely handicaps an indepth analysis).  Therefore, I will be setting the build's actual naked AC stat to 29 (no Tumble AC at all) until such time as this issue has been corrected.

Take it easy my friend, reviewing 4-5 builds a day isn't an easy task, especially when we do not have much free time in our hands.
